segment.source: How to Import an Application
segment.target: How to Import an Application

segment.source: How to Import an Application
segment.target: How to Import an Application

segment.source: How to Import an Application
segment.target: How to Import an Application

segment.source: Typically, you import applications to make them available to stream from an Application Virtualization Management Server.
segment.target: Typically, you import applications to make them available to stream from an Application Virtualization Management Server.

segment.source: You can also add an application manually, but you must provide precise, detailed information about the application to do so.
segment.target: You can also add an application manually, but you must provide precise, detailed information about the application to do so.

segment.source: For more information, see How to Manually Add an Application.
segment.target: For more information, see How to Manually Add an Application.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To import an application, you must have its sequenced Open Software Descriptor (OSD) file or its Sequencer Project (SPRJ) file available on the server.
segment.target: To import an application, you must have its sequenced Open Software Descriptor (OSD) file or its Sequencer Project (SPRJ) file available on the server.

segment.source: When importing an application, you should make sure the server is configured with a value in the Default Content Path field on the General tab of the System Options dialog (accessible by right-clicking the Application Virtualization System node in the App-V Server Console).
segment.target: When importing an application, you should make sure the server is configured with a value in the Default Content Path field on the General tab of the System Options dialog (accessible by right-clicking the Application Virtualization System node in the App-V Server Console).

segment.source: The default content path value defines where the applications will be imported, and during the import process, this value is used to modify the paths defined in the OSD file for the SFT file and for the icon shortcuts.
segment.target: The default content path value defines where the applications will be imported, and during the import process, this value is used to modify the paths defined in the OSD file for the SFT file and for the icon shortcuts.

segment.source: In the OSD file, the path for the SFT file is specified in the CODEBASE HREF entry and the path for the icons is specified in the SHORTCUTS entry.
segment.target: In the OSD file, the path for the SFT file is specified in the CODEBASE HREF entry and the path for the icons is specified in the SHORTCUTS entry.

segment.source: During the import process, the protocol, server, and, if present, port specified in these two paths in the OSD file will be replaced with the value from the default content path.
segment.target: During the import process, the protocol, server, and, if present, port specified in these two paths in the OSD file will be replaced with the value from the default content path.

segment.source: The following table provides an example of how the import path will be affected.
segment.target: The following table provides an example of how the import path will be affected.

segment.source: Default Content Path
segment.target: Default Content Path

segment.source: OSD File CODEBASE HREF
segment.target: OSD File CODEBASE HREF

segment.source: Resulting Value
segment.target: Resulting Value

segment.source: server\content\
segment.target: server\content\

segment.source: http://WebServer/myFolder/package.sft
segment.target: http://WebServer/myFolder/package.sft

segment.source: server\content\myFolder\package.sft
segment.target: server\content\myFolder\package.sft

segment.source: To import an application
segment.target: To import an application

segment.source: Right-click the Applications node in the left pane, and choose Import Applications.
segment.target: Right-click the Applications node in the left pane, and choose Import Applications.

segment.source: In the Open dialog box, navigate to the application's SPRJ or OSD file.
segment.target: In the Open dialog box, navigate to the application's SPRJ or OSD file.

segment.source: Highlight the file and click Open.
segment.target: Highlight the file and click Open.

segment.source: In the New Application Wizard, be sure the Enabled box is selected for applications you want to stream.
segment.target: In the New Application Wizard, be sure the Enabled box is selected for applications you want to stream.

segment.source: There you can also enter a description and verify the server and file paths.
segment.target: There you can also enter a description and verify the server and file paths.

segment.source: Also, if you have set up license and server groups, you can select those.
segment.target: Also, if you have set up license and server groups, you can select those.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Published Shortcuts screen, select the boxes for the locations where you would like the application shortcuts to appear on the client computers.
segment.target: On the Published Shortcuts screen, select the boxes for the locations where you would like the application shortcuts to appear on the client computers.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: In the File Associations screen, you can add new file associations to this application.
segment.target: In the File Associations screen, you can add new file associations to this application.

segment.source: To do so, click Add, enter the extension (without a preceding dot), enter a description, and click OK.
segment.target: To do so, click Add, enter the extension (without a preceding dot), enter a description, and click OK.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Applications sequenced with Sequencer 4.0 populate the File Associations dialog box when you import or create them through the management console.
segment.target: Applications sequenced with Sequencer 4.0 populate the File Associations dialog box when you import or create them through the management console.

segment.source: Applications with previous Sequencer version packages do not.
segment.target: Applications with previous Sequencer version packages do not.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: In the Access Permissions screen, click Add.
segment.target: In the Access Permissions screen, click Add.

segment.source: Complete the Select Groups dialog box.
segment.target: Complete the Select Groups dialog box.

segment.source: When you finish, click OK.
segment.target: When you finish, click OK.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Summary screen, you can review the import settings.
segment.target: On the Summary screen, you can review the import settings.

segment.source: Click Finish, or click Back to change the import or click Cancel to cancel the import.
segment.target: Click Finish, or click Back to change the import or click Cancel to cancel the import.
